intro: Spigelia hamellioides, commonly known as the Florida stokesia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink to red in color, with five petals and a distinctive corona. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
